statementOfFaith.title: Statement of Faith
statementOfFaith.subtitle: Our theological foundation and beliefs
statementOfFaith.intro: These are the core theological beliefs that guide our school and shape our educational approach. They represent our understanding of God, humanity, salvation, and our calling as a Christian educational community.

beliefs.title: The Triune God
beliefs.content: We uphold that the Lord our God is one; Father, Son, and Holy Spirit, and that He fulfills His sovereign purposes in creation, revelation, redemption, judgment, and the coming of His Kingdom.

beliefs.title: Humanity's Fallen Nature
beliefs.content: We recognize that although God made us in His own image and likeness, granting us dignity and worth, enabling us to respond to Him, we are members of a fallen race, we have sinned and fall short of His glory.

beliefs.title: God's Grace and Redemption
beliefs.content: We believe that the Father has shown us His holy love by giving Jesus Christ, His own Son, for us, when because of our sinfulness and guilt, we were subject to His wrath and condemnation. He has shown us His grace by reconciling sinners to Himself, when they place their trust in the Son of God.

beliefs.title: Jesus Christ Our Lord and Savior
beliefs.content: We confess Jesus Christ as Lord and God, as truly human, born of the Virgin Mary, as a sinless servant, full of grace and truth, as the only mediator and Savior who died on the Cross in our place, representing us before God, redeeming us from the dominion, guilt, and punishment of sin, as victorious over Satan and his forces, who rose from the dead with a glorious body, was taken up on high to be with His Father, and will return one day personally in glory and judgment to establish His Kingdom.

beliefs.title: The Holy Spirit
beliefs.content: We believe in the Holy Spirit, who convicts the world of guilt regarding sin, righteousness, and judgment, who makes the death of Christ effective for sinners, declaring that they must turn to Christ in repentance and directing their trust toward the Lord Jesus Christ, who through the new birth makes us partakers in the life of the risen Christ, and who is present in all believers, illuminating their minds to understand the truth of Scripture, producing His fruit in them, granting them His gifts, and empowering them to witness in the world.

beliefs.title: The Authority of Scripture
beliefs.content: We believe that the Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments are inspired by God, as their authors spoke on behalf of God, being moved by the Holy Spirit, and are therefore completely trustworthy in all they affirm, and thus are our supreme authority in matters of faith and life.

beliefs.title: The Church
beliefs.content: We recognize the church as the body of Christ that remains united and grows in Him, both as a universal community spread throughout the world and as the local congregation in which believers gather.

beliefs.title: The Great Commission
beliefs.content: We recognize Christ's commission to proclaim the good news to all peoples, making disciples and teaching them to obey.

beliefs.title: Love and Service to Our Neighbor
beliefs.content: We recognize Christ's command to love our neighbor, which results in service to the church and society; the pursuit of reconciliation for all, with God and with their neighbor, the proclamation of freedom from all forms of oppression, the extension of Christ's justice in an unjust world, until He comes again.

beliefs.title: The Unity of the Trinity
beliefs.content: We uphold that the Lord our God is one alone in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

statementOfFaith.closing: These beliefs form the foundation of everything we do at CEE, guiding our teaching, our relationships, and our service to students, families, and the community.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy
philosophy.subtitle: The guiding principles of our educational approach
philosophy.intro: We understand holistic education as spiritual, physical, moral, and intellectual growth, impossible to achieve without considering the Bible as our foundation for introducing every aspect of teaching.

biblical.title: Biblical Foundation
biblical.content: We hold the firm conviction that all wisdom and knowledge have their origin in God, who reveals Himself through His Word. For this reason, the Bible is our foundation and authority for every subject, and its principles are integrated into the curriculum.

dignity.title: Human Dignity and Cultural Identity
dignity.content: It is our conviction that for human beings to strengthen their dignity, they must hold their customs, their language, and the proper sense of belonging to their own homeland in high esteem.

bilingual.title: Bilingual Excellence
bilingual.content: We are convinced that teaching a second language is not an end in itself, but only a necessary and useful tool for the child's development toward future involvement at the national and international level in pursuit of their own well-being, that of society, and of their homeland.

items.description: Every subject is taught through the lens of biblical truth and God's revelation

history.title: History of the School
history.subtitle: Our journey from a dream to reality
history.intro: From its beginnings in 1990, CEE has grown to become a cornerstone of Christian bilingual education in Siguatepeque.

late1980s.title: Late 1980s - A Dream is Born
late1980s.content: At the end of the 1980s, a group of parents in Siguatepeque identified the need for an educational institution that, in addition to upholding evangelical principles, would offer quality education with English language proficiency as a cultural and technical tool that would open doors of opportunity for the children and youth of our community.

early1990.title: Early 1990 - Building Support
early1990.content: At the beginning of the last decade of the 20th century, this aspiration was shared with a select group of parents, whose support was fundamental. After making the necessary contacts with an American teacher of extensive professional and spiritual merits, Professor Carol Livingston de Bardales, the decision was made to start Escuela Bilingüe Siguatepeque in August 1990.

august1990.title: August 1990 - Opening Day
august1990.content: The institution began its work with thirteen students in first and second grade. Professor Bardales assumed the direction and teaching of English, while the Spanish area was initially taught by Professor Rosita de Flores.

firstYears.title: First Years - Rented Facilities
firstYears.content: For a time, the school operated in rented classrooms in the building currently occupied by the Central American Biblical Seminary (SEBCAH).

mid1992.title: Mid-1992 - Our Permanent Home
mid1992.content: In mid-1992, we were able to acquire a house and the hangars of what had until then been the base of the venerable Alas de Socorro Mission.

present.title: Present Day - Serving Our Community
present.content: In this location, our educational institution currently operates, providing services at the preschool, elementary, and secondary education levels.

legacy.title: A Legacy of Excellence
legacy.content: From thirteen students to a thriving institution serving hundreds of families, CEE continues to fulfill the vision of its founders: providing Christ-centered, bilingual education that opens doors of opportunity for the children and youth of Siguatepeque.

intro.title: Early Partial Immersion Program
intro.paragraph1: CEE is an early partial immersion program, which means that students learn through two languages (Spanish and English) from the time they begin kindergarten until the time they graduate from high school in the 11th grade.
intro.paragraph2: Approximately half of the students' classes are in Spanish and the other half of their classes are taught in English.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions
faq.intro: Here you'll find answers to the questions we hear most frequently. If you don't find what you're looking for, please don't hesitate to contact us.

questions.question: What grades does CEE offer?
questions.answer: CEE offers education from Pre-Kindergarten through Grade 11 (Bachillerato). Our programs include early childhood education, elementary school, middle school, and high school.

questions.question: What is the enrollment process?
questions.answer: The enrollment process includes an interview with the area director, admission exams, an interview with the guidance counseling department, tuition payment, and document submission if admitted.

questions.question: When is the enrollment period?
questions.answer: The main enrollment period is typically in July for the upcoming school year. However, we may accept students at other times depending on availability. Contact the Administration office in advance, as spaces are limited.

questions.question: Is CEE a bilingual school?
questions.answer: Yes, CEE is an early partial immersion bilingual school. Students learn through both Spanish and English from kindergarten through graduation, with approximately half of their classes in each language.

questions.question: What is the school's educational approach?
questions.answer: We offer Christ-centered education where biblical principles are integrated throughout all subjects. Our goal is to develop students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically.

questions.question: What extracurricular activities are available?
questions.answer: While CEE does not offer traditional extracurricular programs, our students stay active and engaged through a variety of enriching experiences. Throughout the school year, students participate in sports tournaments, community service projects, and diverse academic activities that complement their classroom learning and foster personal growth.

questions.question: Does CEE offer scholarships?
questions.answer: CEE offers financial aid for qualifying families.

questions.question: How can I apply for financial aid?
questions.answer: Contact our administrative office to learn about available financial aid options and the application process. Each case is evaluated individually.

questions.question: What are the school hours?
questions.answer: Specific class schedules vary by level.

questions.question: How can I support CEE?
questions.answer: You can support our school through monetary donations, volunteering, or purchasing items from our Amazon wish lists. Visit our Support page for more information.

stillHaveQuestions.title: Still Have Questions?
stillHaveQuestions.description: If you didn't find the answer you were looking for, we're here to help.
